history.content:
I took both together last semester. The beginning of 186 was covered near the end of 61C. However, I felt that 186 did a better job teaching it anyways.

As far as I remember, MRU is the only thing we learn in both classes. 

===================

You don't need to study ahead at all.  Concurrently is perfect.  Honestly auditing 61c concurrently with 186 is enough.  It'd be nice to know a little bit of binary and the sizes of certain variable types are (e.g. integers are typically 4 bytes) for the first part of one of the projects.  I also agree with the person above, 186 does a better job teaching 61c than 61c does for the parts that overlap lol. (an exaggeration, sort of)

-----------------------------

It's more of the concept of I/Os and cache policies that are important. 186 goes away from big-O notation and focuses more on minimizing I/Os, and that's something the maturity with 61c would help with. But you can probably take them concurrently and be fine.

I took both together last semester. The beginning of 186 was covered near the end of 61C. However, I felt that 186 did a better job teaching it anyways.

As far as I remember, MRU is the only thing we learn in both classes. 

===================

You don't need to study ahead at all.  Concurrently is perfect.  Honestly auditing 61c concurrently with 186 is enough.  It'd be nice to know a little bit of binary and the sizes of certain variable types are (e.g. integers are typically 4 bytes) for the first part of one of the projects.  I also agree with the person above, 186 does a better job teaching 61c than 61c does for the parts that overlap lol. (an exaggeration, sort of)

I took both together last semester. The beginning of 186 was covered near the end of 61C. However, I felt that 186 did a better job teaching it anyways.

As far as I remember, MRU is the only thing we learn in both classes.

children.subject: Yeah there aren't too may topics that overlap in 186 and 61c. I would say just pay attention in class and you do not need to study ahead of time. Both classes are very doable. It might be useful to learn assembly language or look at RISC-V architecture for 61c.

history.content: I plan to take 61C concurrently with 186. Can someone please give me advice on which parts of 61C is used in 186 so I can study ahead? Thx so much!
history.subject: What parts of 61C are needed for 186?
